agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Conducts local health fairs, provides health education services to the public, and maintains the lending library and other information resources for the County.
site_details: Call for information about arranging a group presentation.
site_eligibility: Schools, community organizations, and other groups in Fulton County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Open -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.

site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Fulton County residents. Regulates septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household environmental hazards, such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents, including where to obtain testing and remediation.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Open

site_eligibility: Open

service_description: Provides water quality testing for households in Fulton County
site_details: Walk in to pick up a bottle for testing. Return and drop off sample by the following Wednesday.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers limited adult vaccinations, including tetanus (Tdap), hepatitis A, and hepatitis B.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Age 19 or older -- Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. Provides consultation and licensing for retail food service vendors and food safety education for individuals, health fairs, and community groups.
site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the County or for details about licensing or food safety programs.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF FULTON COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF FULTON COUNTY
service_description: Builds homes for eligible low-income persons in Fulton County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through a zero-interest, low monthly payment loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call to speak with the President to request an application or volunteer information. -- Applications may be downloaded and printed from the website.
site_eligibility: Household income between 30%-80% of area median (Call or see website for current amounts.) -- Stable employment or other source of income (such as SSI or child support) for past 2 years -- Currently have reasonably good credit

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF FULTON COUNTY

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Fulton County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment. For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Fulton County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Fulton County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Call for more information
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: UNITED WE STAND MINISTRIES OF AKRON
agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry and financial assistance.
site_name: UNITED WE STAND MINISTRIES OF AKRON
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Clients make their own selections. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Newcastle or Henry Township -- Limit one visit every 30 days.

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Fulton County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.www.in.gov/dcs/support.htm
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-5pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Fulton County.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.www.mycourts.in.gov/mlpublic
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Fulton County.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
site_details: Call or visit website for more informationwww.co.fulton.in.us/
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides free quality integrated health care for the uninsured of Fulton County and surrounding areas.
service_description: Provides free comprehensive health care, mental health care services provided by doctoral students, and referrals to medically necessary dental and vision services to eligible residents of Fulton County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Fulton County -- Age 18-64 --Uninsured -- Income at or below 250% of the Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases in Fulton County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact the Superior Court.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Fulton County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Offenders assigned to probation by the Fulton Courts
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Fulton County Courts

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500.
site_details: Call, walk in or visit the website for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Fulton County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Fulton County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Fulton County
